HTML:
Decskill was born in 2014 as an IT Talent company, with the main mission of providing value through knowledge. We enable companies to face the challenges of the digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure Technological Capacity, Flexibility and Agility. In numbers, we are a team of +600 people with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid🗺


DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:


  • DECSKILL TALENT, where we provide our customer with an extension of the IT teams in the technological aspects
  • DECSKILL BOOST, a specialised development to increase capacity and optimise Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to your needs, at the desired speed
  • DECSKILL CONNECT, where we provide our clients with consulting services, implementation and management of IT infrastructures


Our practice results in the creation of value for our clients, whether through the delivery of skilled and value-added services, skilled and motivated professionals, or through technology solutions that enable us to operate and transform our clients' businesses.


We are looking for a Data Analyst


👉 What will be your responsibilities?

  • Collaborate with Global Markets stakeholders to understand business challenges and translate them into data-driven solutions.
  • Conduct complex data analysis and generate insights that support strategic decisions and revenue opportunities.
  • Build and maintain dashboards, reports, and analytical tools using Python, SQL, Tableau, Power BI, and other technologies.
  • Contribute to all stages of data processing: from ingestion and transformation to modeling and visualization.
  • Present analytical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear and impactful manner.
  • Drive automation and optimization of recurring reporting and analytical tasks.
  • Foster a proactive, collaborative, and innovation-driven team culture.


✅ What will be the Technical Skills Required?

  • Strong academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
  • Hands-on experience with data analysis using Python (especially with Pandas).
  • Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and transformation.
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
  • Solid understanding of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing (a plus).
  • Exposure to Big Data technologies such as PySpark, Presto, or Airflow (a plus).
  • Familiarity with Power Query and DAX is advantageous.


📍Location: Lisbon


Do you want to know more?

send your CV in English to alexandre.cruz@decskill.com with reference “AC/DataAnalyst”


**Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all its talents. We capture and promote talent, from diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the person.

Title: Senior Data analyst - Paris (75) H/F
Description:
Description Externe

Analyste données confirmé(e) (Senior Data analyst)

Expert de la distribution multicanale pour le monde de l’énergie, Rexel accompagne ses clients professionnels dans la mise en œuvre de solutions innovantes et durables, où qu'ils soient. Engagé vers une croissance durable, la digitalisation et l’innovation sont au cœur de l’entreprise.

A ce titre, la Direction de la Tarification recherche un(e) analyste données confirmé(e) en CDI basé au siège à Paris.

VOTRE QUOTIDIEN

Au sein de la direction Marketing et Communications, vous rejoignez une équipe de 12 personnes sous le management de la directrice de la tarification.

Vos Principales Missions

Analyse et exploitation des données :


Collecter, nettoyer et structurer les données provenant de différentes sources (internes et externes).
Elaborer des rapports et des tableaux de bord pour suivre les indicateurs de la performance pricing et marge
Réaliser des analyses approfondies pour identifier des tendances, des corrélations et des opportunités.


Développement des modèles d’analyse pricing, promo et marge :


Concevoir et maintenir des modèles d’analyse prédictive ou descriptive permettant de comprendre les comportements d’achat des clients, d’améliorer les positionnements tarifaires et/ou d’ajuster les campagnes promotionnelles
Automatiser les processus de collecte et de reporting pour gagner en efficacité.
Participer à l’amélioration des outils et des systèmes de gestion de données.


Support Transverse Aux Différentes Équipes Métiers


Collaborer avec les équipes métiers, en plus de la tarification et notamment le Category Management, les Achat, le Commerce et le Contrôle de Gestion, pour comprendre leurs besoins et proposer des solutions adaptées.
Accompagner les utilisateurs dans l’interprétation des données et l’utilisation des outils analytiques.
Identifier les leviers d’optimisation des processus métiers grâce aux données.



VOS QUALITÉS ET COMPÉTENCES

Issu(e) d'un Bac + 5, type diplôme d'ingénieur (statistiques, mathématiques, informatique, data science ou équivalent), et justifiant au minimum de trois ans d’expérience professionnelle dans les analyses poussées des données volumique.

Compétences Techniques


Maîtrise des outils de visualisation de données (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, etc.).
Bonne connaissance des langages de programmation et de manipulation de données (SQL, Python, R, etc.).
Bonne compréhension des bases de données relationnelles et des systèmes de gestion de données.
Connaissance des techniques d’analyse statistique et des modèles prédictifs.


Compétences Métiers


Capacité à comprendre les enjeux métiers et à traduire les besoins en solutions analytiques.
Aptitude à vulgariser les résultats d’analyse pour les rendre accessibles aux non-experts.


Soft Skills


Esprit analytique et rigueur.
Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec des interlocuteurs variés.
Autonomie et proactivité dans la gestion des projets.


D’AUTRES RAISONS DE NOUS REJOINDRE


Un package de rémunération attractif (salaire sur 13 mois, variable, participation, mutuelle, prévoyance)
Des formations adaptées grâce à la Rexel Academy (environ 37000 heures de formation dispensées chaque année)
Un parcours d’intégration construit sur mesure
De nombreuses opportunités d’évolutions internes en France et à l’international (450 mobilités internes réalisées par an en moyenne)
Un environnement dynamique, innovant et digitalisé dans lequel évoluer
80% de nos collaborateurs déclarent travailler dans un esprit d’équipe et de coopération. (enquête interne 2018)


QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

Société cotée en bourse et présente dans 26 pays, Rexel fournit des équipements électriques, des services et des solutions sur mesure aux professionnels intervenant dans la construction, la rénovation ou la maintenance des bâtiments et des infrastructures.

En France, Rexel compte 5 000 collaborateurs, 460 agences et 8 centres logistique pour un chiffre d’affaires de 3 milliards d’euros.

Vous êtes motivé pour rejoindre une équipe de passionnés, conviviale et centrée sur ses clients ? Envoyez-nous votre candidature !
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - B2B Contract - Candidates must be based in Portugal




Location: Portugal (Fully remote)

Type: Contract




Currently partnered with a Global Software Engineering Company on the lookout for a Data Analyst!




About the Role:

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst with at least 5 years of experience to join a forward-thinking team. You’ll play a key role in developing data models, dashboards, and reports that drive strategic decisions. Working closely with stakeholders, you’ll define KPIs, standardize reporting, and transform complex datasets into actionable insights.




What You’ll Be Doing:

Designing and optimizing Power BI dashboards using DAX & Power Query

Writing and optimizing advanced SQL queries for data extraction and analysis

Developing robust data models to support decision-making processes

Standardizing KPIs and ensuring consistency across business units

Engaging with stakeholders to translate business needs into data solutions




Skills:

5+ years of experience in data analytics

Expertise in Power BI (DAX, Power Query) and SQL

Strong background in data modeling and analysis

Experience in dashboard & report development

Excellent stakeholder communication skills




Interview Process:

Intro Call – 30 min

Technical Exercise

Technical Interview – 2 hours

Cultural Fit Interview – 1 hour




If you’re looking for an opportunity to work on exciting projects, apply now!

Title: Prácticas en Análisis de Datos y Power BI (Madrid) (12289)
Description:
Prácticas en Análisis de Datos y Power BI (Madrid)




Nuestro negocio de Redes de Electricidad España (UFD) está inmerso en un apasionante reto de transformación, que tiene como misión la digitalización y sensorización de nuestra red eléctrica para evolucionar de una red meramente física a una red virtual, donde el análisis de datos y la inteligencia artificial nos permitan gestionar y dar respuesta a todas las necesidades del nuevo ecosistema sostenible.




¡Queremos ser los mejores en lo que hacemos! Trabajando en equipo, haciendo más con menos y desarrollando a cada persona, para crecer juntos tanto en el ámbito de Redes Electricidad España como en el de otros negocios.




En este contexto ofrecemos una Beca en el negocio de Redes Electricidad España.




Estas prácticas te permitirán:

Participar en la elaboración de cuadros de mando en Power BI a partir de información de sistemas de UFD con el objetivo de disponer de KPIs que permitan hacer un seguimiento y análisis sobre el avance del proceso de control de calidad regulatoria.




Lo que necesitas:

Estudiante de último curso del grado en Ingeniería Industrial, Matemática, Física, Estadística o similares.
Conocimiento bases de datos
Conocimiento de PowerBI




Lo que ofrecemos:

Ayuda al estudio
Lugar de realización de las prácticas en Madrid, presencialmente en las oficinas de AV. de América 38




1) Rellena el formulario con tus datos. No olvides adjuntar tu CV actualizado.

2) Si te encuentras entre los perfiles más ajustados, contactaremos contigo para participar en las diferentes pruebas y entrevistas.

3) Si avanzas con éxito en el proceso………. ¡podrás formarte con el equipo Naturgy!

Title: Analista de dados
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?




Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.




Developing projects in the most diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others –, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.




We seek a Data Analyst willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team.




*For this position, you must have a residency in Porto or Lisbon.




Are you the one?




🔹 Responsibilities:

Analyze and interpret large datasets to generate valuable insights 💡
Create interactive reports and dashboards to support decision-making 📈
Collaborate closely with teams across different areas to solve strategic challenges 🤝
Ensure data quality and integrity 🔒




Requirements:

Experience with tools like Excel, SQL, Power BI, or Tableau 🖥️
Knowledge of Google Analytics and Big Data is a plus 🔍
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail 🔎
Good communication skills and ability to work in a team 🗣️




We believe we are the ones to, by:

🔹Providing a multidisciplinary Team.

🔹Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.

🔹Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.

🔹Providing you with a custom training plan.

🔹Helping you reach happiness.




Oh… and by the way, we also have:

🔹Several challenging complex projects.

🔹Stimulating teams and leaders.

🔹World-class Clients and Partners.




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to margarida.novais@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.




Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.




At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil e Tunísia. Contamos com mais de 11 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.

Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.

Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.

O que procuramos

  • Formação superior em Engenharia Informática ou similar (valorizado);
  • Experiência mínima de 2 anos com PowerBI;
  • Domínio de ferramentas Microsoft Office (preferencialmente Access e Excel);
  • Bons conhecimentos de inglês (mínimo B2).

Ser Affinity

  • #Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
  • #Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;
  • #Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;
  • #Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.


A tua #LifetimeExperience

  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.

Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.

Join the Experience!


Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:

https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum’s team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum’s solutions aim at contributing to its clients’ performance and innovation as well as the common good.










About the Role




To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell. As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team.




Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation).




You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving.




You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analyzing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic decisions.




You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholders' needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis.







Responsibilities







To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell.




As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team.




Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation).




You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving.




You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analyzing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic decisions.




You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals.




It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholders' needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis.







Technical Skills:




Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields




Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI




Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)




Proficiency in SQL




Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus




Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus




Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus




Language Skills:




Fluency in English




Soft Skills:




Be driven, enthusiastic and dynamic in search of improving processes, controls & procedure




Be pro-active, enthusiastic and able to work well in a team

  • To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell. As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team.


  • Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation).


  • You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving.


  • You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analyzing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic decisions.


  • You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholders' needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis.



Responsibilities



  • To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell.


  • As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team.


  • Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation).


  • You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving.


  • You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analyzing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic decisions.


  • You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals.


  • It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholders' needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis.



Technical Skills:


  • Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields


  • Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI


  • Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)


  • Proficiency in SQL


  • Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus


  • Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus


  • Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus


Language Skills:


  • Fluency in English


Soft Skills:


  • Be driven, enthusiastic and dynamic in search of improving processes, controls & procedure


  • Be pro-active, enthusiastic and able to work well in a team

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.


Neotalent, the responsive people.

Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.



Role Overview:

We are currently recruiting a Data Analyst to integrate an international project in the corporate banking sector. The client in question is one of the biggest banks in Europe, with activity in over 75 countries around the world, it also counts with over 175 years of existence which means that is an extremely consolidated player in the banking industry.


What you will do:

You will be part of an international and diverse team supporting the Global Markets Front Office in understanding their clients, identifying opportunities, and uncovering trends through data analysis. Your role will involve working closely with various business areas within the bank, providing valuable insights to drive business growth by understanding their needs and implementing data-driven solutions, including analysis, visualization, and automation. You will be responsible for retrieving, preparing, and analyzing complex datasets using statistical models and best practices in data visualization to create reports and develop automated tools that support strategic decision-making. Additionally, you will bridge technical and non-technical areas, ensuring clear communication between stakeholders and the technical team by translating business needs into technical requirements and effectively presenting complex analysis results.


What you are like:

  • Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields;
  • Experience in data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI;
  • Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas);
  • Proficiency in SQL;
  • Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus;
  • Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus;
  • Strong organizational and planning skills;
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Proficiency in English (mandatory).


Why join us:

  • Work on challenging projects for big clients;
  • Learn more about emerging technologies;
  • Possibility of working remotely;
  • Design your career plan;
  • Access to continuous training and certifications;
  • Evolve through our internal mobility program;
  • … and much more!

Title: Analista de Datos & BI
Description:
En esta posición, participarás en un equipo innovador donde cada análisis y modelo de datos contribuirá directamente a la toma de decisiones estratégicas. Trabajarás con herramientas punteras, creando informes y cuadros de mando que facilitarán la visualización y explotación de los datos.







💡 ¿Qué te ofrecemos?

✅ Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido.

✅ Formación continua para impulsar tu desarrollo profesional.

✅ Flexibilidad horaria y teletrabajo para una mejor conciliación.

✅ Posibilidad de trabajar de forma híbrida en nuestras sedes de Gran Canaria, Tenerife o Madrid, o de forma remota si tu residencia es diferente.







💡 ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?

🔹 Definirás y desarrollarás modelos de datos, informes y cuadros de mando para proporcionar información clave a los negocios.

🔹 Analizarás los requerimientos de los usuarios de negocio, asegurando que el reporting y la analítica de datos respondan a sus necesidades.

🔹 Construirás ETLs para cargar información al DWH del grupo, facilitando el acceso a los datos mediante herramientas de visualización.

🔹 Mantendrás y evolucionarás los modelos de datos, permitiendo el autoconsumo por parte de los usuarios de negocio.

🔹 Monitorizarás y diagnosticarás posibles incidencias en la actualización y consulta de la información disponible.

🔹 Darás soporte a los usuarios para que comprendan y utilicen correctamente los datos.

🔹 Garantizarás la seguridad, ejecutando de manera rigurosa y eficiente las medidas necesarias para la protección de la información.







✔️ Requisitos imprescindibles:

✅ Formación universitaria en Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística, Física, Ingeniería Industrial o similar.

✅ Experiencia de 1 a 3 años en un puesto similar.

✅ Nivel de inglés suficiente para desenvolverte en un entorno profesional.







✨ Además, valoramos positivamente si cuentas con:

🔹 Conocimientos en lenguajes propios del BI y Big Data: SQL y DAX.

🔹 Conocimientos en estadística, algoritmos, análisis de datos y tecnologías de almacenamiento e integración de datos.

🔹 Experiencia en analítica avanzada y aprendizaje automático con tecnologías Big Data.

🔹 Manejo de otros lenguajes como Python, PySpark o lenguaje M (Power Query).

🔹 Uso de herramientas de visualización como Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, etc.

🔹 Familiaridad con ecosistemas y metodologías como Azure, Databricks, DevOps, GIT o Power Platform (Power Automate y Power Apps).

🔹 Conocimientos en protección de datos y seguridad de la información.







Buscamos a alguien con mentalidad analítica, iniciativa y pasión por la transformación digital. Si cumples con el perfil y quieres crecer en un entorno dinámico, ¡queremos conocerte!




🚀 Si te apasionan los datos y quieres impulsar tu carrera en un entorno dinámico, ¡esta es tu oportunidad!




Las personas que concurran a los procesos de selección y evaluación serán valoradas en base a los requisitos del puesto de trabajo con objetividad, transparencia y respetando el principio de igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres.

Show more

Title: Junior Analytics Consultant
Description:
Who are we?

For over 40 years, ProStrategy has been helping businesses to transform and grow through the delivery of ERP, Customer Engagement, Enterprise Performance Management and Data Analytics solutions from our offices in Cork & Dublin. As a leading Gold Microsoft Partner, we have been implementing business solutions for our clients across a variety of diverse industries.




Who are we looking for?

This is an outstanding opportunity for a junior data engineer with aspirations to move into a technical consulting role. This individual will have the opportunity to support several of our existing clients and the chance to develop their consultative skills by working on a variety of different projects.




What will you be doing?




Assist in the management and delivery of development tasks. Collaborate with Senior Consultants to understand project requirements and objectives.
Gather requirements from clients, generate estimates, functional specs, and review them with senior team
Work closely with the Project Manager, aiding in the identification of tasks and actions necessary for project delivery.
Resolve client UAT issues with guidance from more experienced staff.
Support the enforcement of coding standards among internal and external developers under the mentorship of senior consultants.
Cover data related technical support (first line on rotation)




Requirements:

Strong communication skills.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Maths or a related field.
Basic understanding of data engineering concepts and practices.
Familiarity with the Microsoft technology stack, including Fabric, SQL Server, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, and Power BI.
Knowledge of SQL and experience with database management and data modelling.
Exposure to ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools within the Microsoft ecosystem.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're looking for a detail-oriented Data Analyst with a focus on payments and success rate analytics. In this role, you'll use your expertise in Excel and data analytics to analyze payment data, monitor success rates, and provide insights that drive business performance and efficiency.

Responsibilities


Analyze payment data to identify trends and areas for improvement in success rates, transaction volumes, and customer behavior
Utilize Excel (VLOOKUP, PivotTables, Power Query) to clean and analyze large datasets
Provide ad-hoc data analysis to support decision-making across teams
Investigate payment data discrepancies and recommend improvements
Monitor payment system performance and report on success rates
Suggest improvements to enhance payment processes and user experience
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in payment analytics



Requirements


Advanced proficiency in Excel (VLOOKUP, PivotTables, etc.)
Experience in data analysis, particularly with payments or financial data
Ability to analyze large datasets and provide actionable insights
Knowledge of payment systems and transaction processing
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Experience with analytics tools (SQL, Power BI, Tableau) is a plus
Strong communication skills for presenting findings to non-technical stakeholders.



Preferred


Familiarity with payment gateways or fraud detection systems
Knowledge of Python or R for advanced analytics



Benefits


Spacious and modern office
Free parking space
Flexible working hours
Free lunch in the office
Social guarantees and health insurance
Company sponsored professional training, certifications ,and conferences
Social events - team building, corporate events
Friendly and experienced team members who will support your professional growth
Hybrid work

Title: Business Intelligence
HTML:
Com mais de 8 anos de existência a nível nacional, contamos com mais de 200 colaboradores com o nosso ADN e posicionamo-nos no mercado com 3 ofertas de serviço:

  • Strategy (Outsourcing, NeXel, Team as a Service, Tech Academies);
  • R&D (Estágios, POC, Laboratório Tecnológico);
  • Nearshore.


Na ADENTIS centramo-nos nas PESSOAS e é este o nosso salário emocional:

  • Equilíbrio entre a vida profissional e pessoal;
  • Flexibilidade na rotina organizacional;
  • Benefícios de saúde para colaboradores e familiares;
  • Eventos Team Building;
  • Protocolo com mais de 300 parceiros;
  • Formação contínua através de um centro profissional de formação e certificação;
  • Acompanhamento e feedback contínuo através de um plano personalizado;
  • Progressão de carreira através de avaliações objetivas e diretas.



O que procuramos:

  • Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática ou similares;
  • Experiência comprovada no desenvolvimento de sistemas de Business Intelligence com um mínimo de 2 anos de experiência;
  • Experiência em ferramentas de BI da Microsoft, tais como PowerBI, Analysis Services e Integration Services, com um mínimo de 2 anos de experiência.
  • Sólida experiência em SQL;
  • Experiência em migração de dados;
  • Data Bricks e Microsoft Fabric;
  • Facilidade de relacionamento e comunicação com diferentes stakeholders (clientes, equipa).
  • Inglês fluente, falado e escrito.


Se queres fazer parte de uma empresa People First, junta-te a nós.

We walk with you!


Na Adentis defendemos a igualdade e valorizamos a diversidade. Criamos um ambiente seguro, diversificado e onde as oportunidades são iguais para todos os colaboradores!

Não discriminamos com base em idade, etnia, orientação sexual, género, deficiência ou qualquer fator que não seja o mérito.

Todas as candidaturas com competências para o cargo são bem-vindas!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

For more than 20 years, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftspeople has delivered cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of AI driven digital transformation. Since 2001, we have grown into a full service digital consulting company with 5500+ professionals working on a worldwide ambition. Driven by the desire to make a difference, we keep innovating. Fuelling the growth of our company with our knowledge worker culture. When teaming up with Xebia, expect in-depth expertise based on an authentic, value-led, and high quality way of working that inspires all we do.




About the Role

We are looking for a seasoned Analyst and Data Visualisation Expert to support the data science and analytics team focused on Direct To Consumer data products. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools. You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations with especial focus on clickstream data. You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.




Responsibilities

Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.




Your background

3+ years of professional experience analysing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarise, and analyse data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. e-commerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.
Show more

  • Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
  • Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
  • Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
  • Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
  • Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
  • Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
  • Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.


Your background

  • 3+ years of professional experience analysing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
  • 3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
  • 3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
  • Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarise, and analyse data.
  • Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. e-commerce platforms are a plus.
  • Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
  • Strong problem solving skills.
  • Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.

Title: Junior Data Science
Description:
Samba TV tracks streaming and broadcast video across the world with our proprietary data and technology. We are on a mission to fundamentally transform the viewing experience for everyone. Our data enables media companies to connect with audiences for new shows and movies, and enables advertisers to engage viewers and measure reach across all their devices. We have an amazing story with a unique perspective on culture formed by a global footprint of data and AI-driven insights.




We’re looking for a Junior Data Scientist to support our data operations by handling large-scale datasets, ensuring data quality, and running algorithms to match external data with our proprietary datasets. This role is ideal for someone detail-oriented, eager to work with real-world data, and looking to grow into a more analytical position over time.




Key Responsibilities:
Collect, process, and clean data received from clients to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Assist in developing new algorithms.
Identify and troubleshoot data inconsistencies or gaps, working with internal teams and clients to resolve issues.
Support data validation and quality assurance processes to improve the reliability of our datasets.
Assist in creating reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate findings.
Collaborate with senior data scientists, engineers, and Product teams to enhance our data pipelines and algorithms.




Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or similar).
2 years of experience in data analysis, data processing, or related fields
Experience with data visualization (e.g., Databricks Tableau, Seaborn) and data cleaning & processing (e.g., Pandas, SQL).
Strong programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and big data tools (e.g., PySpark) is a plus
Excellent problem-solving skills and a willingness to take ownership of data-related tasks.




Why Join Us?
Gain hands-on experience working with real-world, large-scale datasets.
Learn from experienced data scientists and engineers in a collaborative environment.
Exposure to data engineering, matching algorithms, and cloud technologies.







Samba TV is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  We strive to empower connection with one another, reflect the communities we serve, and tackle meaningful projects that make a real impact.

Samba TV may collect personal information directly from you, as a job applicant, Samba TV may also receive personal information from third parties, for example, in connection with a background, employment or reference check, in accordance with the applicable law. For further details, please see Samba's Applicant Privacy Policy. For residents of the EU , Samba Inc. is the data controller.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
SymBio Recruitment GmbH steht für mehr als nur Personalvermittlung.

Wir sind Ihre Wegbegleiter in der Welt der beruflichen Entwicklung.




Unser Ziel ist es, nicht nur Unternehmen und Fachkräfte zusammenzubringen, sondern auch Ihre persönlichen Stärken und beruflichen Ambitionen optimal zu fördern. Wir nehmen uns die Zeit, Ihre individuellen Bedürfnisse zu verstehen und bieten Ihnen eine maßgeschneiderte Betreuung, die über den üblichen Standard hinausgeht.




Standort: Nürnberg

Anstellungsart: Festanstellung – Unbefristet - Vollzeit

Arbeitsmodell: Hybrid




Weiterentwicklung und Optimierung bestehender Dashboards und Reporting-Tools
Enge Abstimmung mit den Fachabteilungen zur Erstellung präziser und aussagekräftiger Analysen
Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Strategien zur Datenintegration und Analyse, insbesondere zur Unterstützung von Finanzplanung, Budgetierung und Prognosen
Sicherstellung einer hohen Datenqualität und -verfügbarkeit durch regelmäßige Validierung und Anpassung der Datenprozesse
Konsolidierung und Modellierung von Daten aus unterschiedlichen Quellen, um wertvolle Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen




Ihr Profil:

Fundierte Berufserfahrung in den oben genannten Bereichen, idealerweise mit Branchenkenntnissen in der Logistik oder Spedition
Sicherer Umgang mit BI- und Analyse-Tools, vorzugsweise Power BI
Kenntnisse in SQL-basierten Datenmodellen und Datenaufbereitungen sind von Vorteil
Analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen sowie Freude an der Verbindung von Fachwissen und IT-Lösungen
Kommunikationsstärke und Teamgeist zur erfolgreichen Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift C1 Level




Das bietet unser Mandant

Modernes und innovatives Arbeitsumfeld mit Zukunftsperspektive.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten & Home-Office-Möglichkeiten.
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten zur fachlichen und persönlichen Entwicklung.
Attraktive Vergütung und Karrierechancen in einem dynamischen Unternehmen.
Spannende Projekte mit den neuesten Technologien im Bereich RPA & Digitalisierung.




Egal, wo du in Deutschland beruflich durchstarten möchtest – SymBio Recruitment GmbH ist dein verlässlicher Partner, der dich auf deinem Weg unterstützt. Entdecke mit uns neue berufliche Perspektiven und erlebe, wie wir deine Karriere gemeinsam gestalten.

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Power Platform
Description:
🚀¿Te interesa el mundo del dato, la automatización y las herramientas low-code? ¡Tenemos una gran oportunidad para ti!.




Desde Adecco, nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un perfil Junior Data Analyst con foco en Power Platform para incorporar en un entorno internacional, innovador y con proyectos punteros de visualización y automatización.




🎁 ¿Qué se ofrece?




💼 Contratación directa e indefinida por cliente final.

🏢Modelo híbrido.

📍Ubicación en Málaga.

🌍 Entorno internacional, dinámico y en crecimiento.




💡 ¿Qué harás en este rol?




🔹 Participarás en la automatización de procesos y recogida de requisitos de negocio.

🔹 Desarrollarás dashboards, KPIs y modelos de datos (estrella, copo de nieve).

🔹 Crearás flujos en Power Automate y aplicaciones con Power Apps.

🔹 Modelarás y transformarás datos para facilitar su explotación en Power BI.

🔹 Colaborarás en la definición de roles de acceso y seguridad en visualizaciones.




🎯 Requisitos clave:




✅ Grado o titulación técnica relacionada con Tecnología o Informática.

✅ Conocimiento en Power BI, Power Apps y Power Automate.

✅ Experiencia (académica o práctica) con modelos de datos relacionales.

✅ Metodologías Agile (Jira, Confluence, DevOps).

✅ Español fluido (C1) e inglés intermedio (B2).




🌟 Será un plus si cuentas con:




🔹 Conocimientos en Location Intelligence, Data Governance y visualización avanzada (D3.js, JS).

🔹 Experiencia en pipelines CI/CD (Jenkins) y gestión de calidad del dato.




Si cumples con los requisitos y quieres un nuevo reto, ¡inscríbete ahora! 📩

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in Málaga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our Málaga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

• Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

• Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

• Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

• Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

• Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

• Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

• Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

• Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

• Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

• Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

• Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

• Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

• Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

• High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

• Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

• Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

• Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

• Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what’s in it for you?

🆙 Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

🏠 Hybrid Work

💰 Competitive compensation structure

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

🛟 Life Insurance

📈 Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

🛬 Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Data Analyst – Material
Description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com

Job Function

Data Analytics & Computational Sciences

Job Sub Function

Business Intelligence

Job Category

Professional

All Job Posting Locations:

Beerse, Antwerp, Belgium, Geel, Antwerp, Belgium, Latina, Italy

Job Description

Master Data team on transcend Pharm is hiring a resource for the following open role: Material Master Data Analyst. This position will report to Material Master Data DPO and can be located in Latina IT, Beerse BE

Roles And Responsibilities


Support the Material Master DPO (Design & Process Owner) and Workstream during all phases of the program: design & build, execution and deployment
Drive workshops to collect and record user requirements for S4Hana Material configuration, Material workflow configuration and Data Quality
Participate in design workshops with Transcend functional teams to define design requirements for Material Master
Perform data profiling in legacy ERPs.
Identify data harmonization and data de-duplication needs for Materials in legacy ERPs.
Support Data Migration team with user requirement for Material Master Data conversions.
Support Data Migration team with pre and post load validation of Material master data during each testing cycle and at Cutover.
Support Workflow deployment team with requirements, design and testing of Material master data workflows.
Create user requirements, test scripts and defects in JIRA and /or Smartsheet.
Create KDDs and Functional documentations for S4Hana design, for Material master.
Perform FIT and BST testing of Material Master Data configuration in SAP.
Perform FIT and BST testing of Material Master Data workflow scenarios.
Support Business SMEs with UAT prep and execution.
Coordination of Dual Data Maintenance activities.
Support Data Ops team during Hypercare


Qualifications


Experience with SAP Material master data required. Other SAP objects preferred.
Experience with ERP deployments is a plus.
5+ years of Supply Chain experience in any functional area.
3+ years of experience with Materials master data.
Good understanding of NPI (new product introduction) in Pharm industry.
Data migration experience in SAP is a plus.
Expert in Excel (create formulas, macros, pivot tables, advanced filters and charts)
Proficient in SQL, Phyton or other data interrogation tools
Experience with Data Quality, Profiling and Cleansing, Data harmonization
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to travel internationally 10% of time.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: 3+ years

Location : Hybrid- Lisbon




Skills Needed?




Bachelor / Master in Computer Engineering or similar;
3+ years of experience in data analysis;
Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and data extraction;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker);
Experience working with python;
Familiarity with databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Snowflake;
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills,
Good level of English and Portuguese;
Good level of french is a plus;
The candidate has to be in Portugal.







Why should you become part of our family?




You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.

Title: Analista ESG – Dati e Reporting - STAGE
Description:
Iper, La grande i,

Azienda italiana leader della Distribuzione Moderna Organizzata (DMO), ricerca per la propria sede di Milano (MI) un/a Analista ESG – Dati e Reporting in STAGE

Posizione:

Il Gruppo Finiper Canova è alla ricerca di un/una Analista ESG in STAGE per supportare il team nella gestione dei dati ESG, nell’analisi e nella reportistica.

La figura si occuperà, in supporto ai colleghi, di analizzare e monitorare le performance ESG aziendali, supportando anche la gestione di progetti legati alla sostenibilità.

Responsabilità:


Raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare dati ESG per misurare le performance aziendali e identificare opportunità di miglioramento.
Supportare la redazione dei report ESG (ad esempio, Bilancio di Sostenibilità, reporting GRI, TCFD, ecc.) per stakeholder interni ed esterni.
Garantire l'accuratezza e l'affidabilità dei dati ESG, collaborando con altri dipartimenti per ottenere le informazioni necessarie.
Supportare la gestione di progetti di sostenibilità, come iniziative di economia circolare, efficienza energetica o engagement dei dipendenti.
Monitorare e aggiornare il team sulle evoluzioni normative e sugli standard di settore legati alla rendicontazione ESG.
Contribuire alla creazione di dashboard e strumenti di visualizzazione dei dati per comunicare in modo chiaro e trasparente le prestazioni ESG.
Partecipare alla promozione di una cultura della sostenibilità all'interno dell’organizzazione.

Requisiti:


Laurea in Economia, Scienze Ambientali, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini.
Buona conoscenza degli standard di reporting ESG (es. GRI, SASB, TCFD) e dei nuovi indicatori ESRS previsti dalla CSRD.
Eccellenti capacità analitiche, con padronanza di strumenti come Excel, Power BI o altri software di analisi dati.
Precisione e attenzione ai dettagli, con capacità organizzative e di gestione documentale.
Ottime capacità comunicative, scritte e orali, con predisposizione al lavoro in team.

Esperienza di 1 anno in ambito ESG, sostenibilità o analisi dei dati (anche attraverso stage o tirocini) verrà considerata un plus.

Altre informazioni:

La selezione è rivolta a candidati dell’uno e dell’altro sesso ai sensi del D. Lgs. 198/2006. Tutte le candidature devono essere accompagnate dalla autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali e saranno gestite ai sensi del Regolamento Europeo 2016/679 ( c.d. GDPR).

Per ulteriori informazioni circa le opportunità professionali ed il mondo di Iper, La grande i diventa follower della nostra pagina Linkedin (click su "Segui" al link https://www.linkedin.com/company-beta/152414/)

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst that want to play a key role in shaping data-driven insights and deliver functional Power BI solutions? Do you want to support one of Europe’s largest residential portfolios, providing essential data insights to business users? Then this role with us, may be your next step!







The Team

Join the AnalytiX team as our Data Analyst and contribute to our mission of delivering innovative Power BI solutions and automating manual data processes. You’ll be part of a cross-functional team consisting of data engineers, data analysts. You’ll have opportunities to collaborate across Data & AnalytiX function, where our shared passion for data drives us toward common goals of quality and ensuring satisfaction with our products.

This full-time position is based in either our Copenhagen group office.







Key Responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role on delivering visually appealing, functional, and high-quality Power BI reports and ensuring adoption by connecting with end-users of the solutions.




your core responsibilities encompass:

Develop, maintain and fine-tune Power BI reports to meet business needs
Provide proactive maintenance of current solutions while optimizing them for better performance
Document solution designs and workflow in Miro for clear communication and alignment
Take part in developing data models that enable self-service BI
Facilitate discussions and meetings with product owners to understand business needs and align solutions accordingly
Ensure the smooth transition of existing solutions to a more scalable and future-proof setup
Contribute to the technical debt management of the Power BI platform and ensure best practices







To fit this role, we look for you who has:

Minimum Bachelor’s degree in relevant fields
Strong passion for statistics and data analysis, and experience with large datasets and dimensional modelling.
Knowledge of ETL tools and data processing techniques.
Experience with data warehousing, data modeling and DAX programming.
Ability to work within an agile setup and prioritize tasks efficiently.
Confidence in engaging with stakeholders across various functions and asking insightful questions.
Fluent in English; Strong verbal/written communication and presentation skills.




You have a systematic, analytical mindset. As a person you are naturally curious about new methods and technologies, enabling effective interaction with both technical and business teams (with the ability to translate tech lingo to something non-tech people can understand). You immediately take our values, Care, Dare, Share to your heart and enjoy working in an informal atmosphere where flexibility and responsibility goes hand in hand.










Join Us

Joining Heimstaden means being part of a team that dreams big, works passionately, and continuously strives for improvement.




We celebrate talent in all its forms and encourage you to apply, even if you don’t meet every qualification listed. Let’s explore together how your unique strengths can contribute to our shared goals.

Apply today to connect with the People & Culture team to further explore this opportunity!







We will initiate conversations with selected candidates prior to the application deadline.

We conduct background checks as part of our recruitment process. If you have any questions regarding this, you are welcome to contact us.




We know the value of challenging unconscious bias and the importance of focusing on the full potential and competences of each individual. That is why we do not require a cover letter when applying to our positions, and we use testing as a tool in the process.

For questions, please contact Franco Hurtado at franco.hurtado@heimstaden.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;




DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;




DECSKILL CONNECT, through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.




Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.




We are looking for an Data Analyst!




Responsibilities:

To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell.
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team.
Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation).
You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic.
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals.




Requirements:

Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI.
Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas).
Proficiency in SQL Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus.
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus.
It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholder™s™ needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis.
Be driven, enthusiastic and dynamic in search of improving processes, controls & procedure.
Be pro-active, enthusiastic and able to work well in a team.
Fluency in English.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference "CA/DataAnalyst".




Thank You.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill was born in 2014 as an IT Talent company, with the main mission of providing value through knowledge. We enable companies to face the challenges of the digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure Technological Capacity, Flexibility and Agility. In numbers, we are a team of +600 people with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid🗺




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:




DECSKILL TALENT, where we provide our customer with an extension of the IT teams in the technological aspects
DECSKILL BOOST, a specialised development to increase capacity and optimise Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to your needs, at the desired speed
DECSKILL CONNECT, where we provide our clients with consulting services, implementation and management of IT infrastructures




Our practice results in the creation of value for our clients, whether through the delivery of skilled and value-added services, skilled and motivated professionals, or through technology solutions that enable us to operate and transform our clients' businesses.




We are looking for a Data Analyst




👉 What will be your responsibilities?

Collaborate with Global Markets stakeholders to understand business challenges and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Conduct complex data analysis and generate insights that support strategic decisions and revenue opportunities.
Build and maintain dashboards, reports, and analytical tools using Python, SQL, Tableau, Power BI, and other technologies.
Contribute to all stages of data processing: from ingestion and transformation to modeling and visualization.
Present analytical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear and impactful manner.
Drive automation and optimization of recurring reporting and analytical tasks.
Foster a proactive, collaborative, and innovation-driven team culture.




✅ What will be the Technical Skills Required?

Strong academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
Hands-on experience with data analysis using Python (especially with Pandas).
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and transformation.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Solid understanding of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing (a plus).
Exposure to Big Data technologies such as PySpark, Presto, or Airflow (a plus).
Familiarity with Power Query and DAX is advantageous.




📍Location: Lisbon




Do you want to know more?

send your CV in English to alexandre.cruz@decskill.com with reference “AC/DataAnalyst”




**Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all its talents. We capture and promote talent, from diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the person.

Title: Senior Data analyst - Paris (75) H/F
Description:
Description Externe

Analyste données confirmé(e) (Senior Data analyst)

Expert de la distribution multicanale pour le monde de l’énergie, Rexel accompagne ses clients professionnels dans la mise en œuvre de solutions innovantes et durables, où qu'ils soient. Engagé vers une croissance durable, la digitalisation et l’innovation sont au cœur de l’entreprise.

A ce titre, la Direction de la Tarification recherche un(e) analyste données confirmé(e) en CDI basé au siège à Paris.

VOTRE QUOTIDIEN

Au sein de la direction Marketing et Communications, vous rejoignez une équipe de 12 personnes sous le management de la directrice de la tarification.

Vos Principales Missions

Analyse et exploitation des données :


Collecter, nettoyer et structurer les données provenant de différentes sources (internes et externes).
Elaborer des rapports et des tableaux de bord pour suivre les indicateurs de la performance pricing et marge
Réaliser des analyses approfondies pour identifier des tendances, des corrélations et des opportunités.


Développement des modèles d’analyse pricing, promo et marge :


Concevoir et maintenir des modèles d’analyse prédictive ou descriptive permettant de comprendre les comportements d’achat des clients, d’améliorer les positionnements tarifaires et/ou d’ajuster les campagnes promotionnelles
Automatiser les processus de collecte et de reporting pour gagner en efficacité.
Participer à l’amélioration des outils et des systèmes de gestion de données.


Support Transverse Aux Différentes Équipes Métiers


Collaborer avec les équipes métiers, en plus de la tarification et notamment le Category Management, les Achat, le Commerce et le Contrôle de Gestion, pour comprendre leurs besoins et proposer des solutions adaptées.
Accompagner les utilisateurs dans l’interprétation des données et l’utilisation des outils analytiques.
Identifier les leviers d’optimisation des processus métiers grâce aux données.



VOS QUALITÉS ET COMPÉTENCES

Issu(e) d'un Bac + 5, type diplôme d'ingénieur (statistiques, mathématiques, informatique, data science ou équivalent), et justifiant au minimum de trois ans d’expérience professionnelle dans les analyses poussées des données volumique.

Compétences Techniques


Maîtrise des outils de visualisation de données (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, etc.).
Bonne connaissance des langages de programmation et de manipulation de données (SQL, Python, R, etc.).
Bonne compréhension des bases de données relationnelles et des systèmes de gestion de données.
Connaissance des techniques d’analyse statistique et des modèles prédictifs.


Compétences Métiers


Capacité à comprendre les enjeux métiers et à traduire les besoins en solutions analytiques.
Aptitude à vulgariser les résultats d’analyse pour les rendre accessibles aux non-experts.


Soft Skills


Esprit analytique et rigueur.
Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec des interlocuteurs variés.
Autonomie et proactivité dans la gestion des projets.


D’AUTRES RAISONS DE NOUS REJOINDRE


Un package de rémunération attractif (salaire sur 13 mois, variable, participation, mutuelle, prévoyance)
Des formations adaptées grâce à la Rexel Academy (environ 37000 heures de formation dispensées chaque année)
Un parcours d’intégration construit sur mesure
De nombreuses opportunités d’évolutions internes en France et à l’international (450 mobilités internes réalisées par an en moyenne)
Un environnement dynamique, innovant et digitalisé dans lequel évoluer
80% de nos collaborateurs déclarent travailler dans un esprit d’équipe et de coopération. (enquête interne 2018)


QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

Société cotée en bourse et présente dans 26 pays, Rexel fournit des équipements électriques, des services et des solutions sur mesure aux professionnels intervenant dans la construction, la rénovation ou la maintenance des bâtiments et des infrastructures.

En France, Rexel compte 5 000 collaborateurs, 460 agences et 8 centres logistique pour un chiffre d’affaires de 3 milliards d’euros.

Vous êtes motivé pour rejoindre une équipe de passionnés, conviviale et centrée sur ses clients ? Envoyez-nous votre candidature !
Show more
