    Issu(e) d'un Bac + 5, type diplôme d'ingénieur (statistiques, mathématiques, informatique, data science ou équivalent), et justifiant au minimum de trois ans d’expérience professionnelle dans les analyses poussées des données volumique.

    Compétences Techniques

    • Maîtrise des outils de visualisation de données (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, etc.).
    • Bonne connaissance des langages de programmation et de manipulation de données (SQL, Python, R, etc.).
    • Bonne compréhension des bases de données relationnelles et des systèmes de gestion de données.
    • Connaissance des techniques d’analyse statistique et des modèles prédictifs.

    Compétences Métiers

    • Capacité à comprendre les enjeux métiers et à traduire les besoins en solutions analytiques.
    • Aptitude à vulgariser les résultats d’analyse pour les rendre accessibles aux non-experts.

    Soft Skills

    • Esprit analytique et rigueur.
    • Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec des interlocuteurs variés.
    • Autonomie et proactivité dans la gestion des projets.

    D’AUTRES RAISONS DE NOUS REJOINDRE

    • Un package de rémunération attractif (salaire sur 13 mois, variable, participation, mutuelle, prévoyance)
    • Des formations adaptées grâce à la Rexel Academy (environ 37000 heures de formation dispensées chaque année)
    • Un parcours d’intégration construit sur mesure
    • De nombreuses opportunités d’évolutions internes en France et à l’international (450 mobilités internes réalisées par an en moyenne)
    • Un environnement dynamique, innovant et digitalisé dans lequel évoluer
    • 80% de nos collaborateurs déclarent travailler dans un esprit d’équipe et de coopération. (enquête interne 2018)

    QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

    Société cotée en bourse et présente dans 26 pays, Rexel fournit des équipements électriques, des services et des solutions sur mesure aux professionnels intervenant dans la construction, la rénovation ou la maintenance des bâtiments et des infrastructures.

    En France, Rexel compte 5 000 collaborateurs, 460 agences et 8 centres logistique pour un chiffre d’affaires de 3 milliards d’euros.

    Vous êtes motivé pour rejoindre une équipe de passionnés, conviviale et centrée sur ses clients ? Envoyez-nous votre candidature !

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's and/or master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar;
At least 5 years as a data analyst
Experience with PowerBI/Tableau
Fluent in English and Portuguese;
Good communication and interpersonal skills;
Be already in Portugal legally, available to do a hybrid model in Lisbon.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been electedWe believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.




Here, you can be totally sure about this: we value each person that joins us. We welcome everyone as part of this family and we do everything we can so that we can learn and grow together.




At KCS IT, we stand for equality and value diversity. We foster a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit.

All applications with the required skills for the position are welcome!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Farfetch is a leading global marketplace for the luxury fashion industry. The Farfetch Marketplace connects customers in over 190 countries and territories with items from more than 50 countries and over 1,400 of the world’s best brands, boutiques, and department stores, delivering a truly unique shopping experience and access to the most extensive selection of luxury on a global marketplace.

OPERATIONS
We're passionate about operational excellence, acting with our customers and partners always in our heart. Covering the entire order journey, we create our online content, secure payments and fraud process compliance, ensure order fulfilment and delivery, while providing customer and partner care. In a nutshell, we love to create seamless and memorable luxury experiences for our customers all around the world.

PORTO
Our office is near Porto, in the north of Portugal, and is located in a vibrant business hub. It offers a dynamic and welcoming environment where our employees can connect and network with a large community of tech professionals.

THE ROLE
Reporting to the Analytics Manager, you’ll help solve complex data challenges and work with a wide range of tools to build accurate, scalable and innovative data solutions. With your analytical expertise and strong problem solving skills you’ll help the FintechOps department make better decisions with data!

What You'll Do


Tackle complex data problems with a variety of tools and implement innovative and scalable solutions
Leverage your proficiency in tools such as BigQuery, dbt and Python to efficiently extract and transform raw datasets into structured and usable formats
Build and maintain data models, reports and dashboards in BigQuery and Looker to provide stakeholders with relevant and timely information
Apply advanced statistical and analytical techniques to extract meaningful insights from large datasets
Proactively identify and resolve data-related issues, ensuring the reliability and integrity of analytical outputs
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and to implement data-driven solutions
Communicate complex findings in a clear and understandable manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders





Who You Are


A bachelor's degree and a minimum of five years of relevant experience are required. Equivalent combinations of education and experience will be considered
Proficiency in SQL (SQL Server, BigQuery, or similar)
Experience using data visualisation tools (Looker, PowerBI, Tableau, or similar)
Knowledge of statistical programming languages like Python and/or R
Ability to work autonomously in solving complex technical problems
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts to a non-technical audience
Advanced in English, both written and oral





Rewards & Benefits


Health insurance for the whole family, flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
Extra days off, sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
Flexible benefits program





EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT


FARFETCH is committed to being an inclusive workplace where diversity in all its forms is celebrated. We make employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law, physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local laws or ordinances. If you require special accommodation, please let us know





SCAM DISCLAIMER


It has come to our attention that there may be fraudulent activities involving individuals or organizations falsely claiming to represent Farfetch in order to attract candidates to a SCAM. Please be aware that Farfetch does not conduct recruitment processes through messaging apps or any unofficial communication channels, other than our official careers website. Additionally, Farfetch will never ask candidates for any form of payment during the recruitment process

Title: Business Intelligence
HTML:
Com mais de 8 anos de existência a nível nacional, contamos com mais de 200 colaboradores com o nosso ADN e posicionamo-nos no mercado com 3 ofertas de serviço:

  • Strategy (Outsourcing, NeXel, Team as a Service, Tech Academies);
  • R&D (Estágios, POC, Laboratório Tecnológico);
  • Nearshore.


Na ADENTIS centramo-nos nas PESSOAS e é este o nosso salário emocional:

  • Equilíbrio entre a vida profissional e pessoal;
  • Flexibilidade na rotina organizacional;
  • Benefícios de saúde para colaboradores e familiares;
  • Eventos Team Building;
  • Protocolo com mais de 300 parceiros;
  • Formação contínua através de um centro profissional de formação e certificação;
  • Acompanhamento e feedback contínuo através de um plano personalizado;
  • Progressão de carreira através de avaliações objetivas e diretas.



O que procuramos:

  • Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática ou similares;
  • Experiência comprovada no desenvolvimento de sistemas de Business Intelligence com um mínimo de 2 anos de experiência;
  • Experiência em ferramentas de BI da Microsoft, tais como PowerBI, Analysis Services e Integration Services, com um mínimo de 2 anos de experiência.
  • Sólida experiência em SQL;
  • Experiência em migração de dados;
  • Data Bricks e Microsoft Fabric;
  • Facilidade de relacionamento e comunicação com diferentes stakeholders (clientes, equipa).
  • Inglês fluente, falado e escrito.


Se queres fazer parte de uma empresa People First, junta-te a nós.

We walk with you!


Na Adentis defendemos a igualdade e valorizamos a diversidade. Criamos um ambiente seguro, diversificado e onde as oportunidades são iguais para todos os colaboradores!

Não discriminamos com base em idade, etnia, orientação sexual, género, deficiência ou qualquer fator que não seja o mérito.

Todas as candidaturas com competências para o cargo são bem-vindas!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

For more than 20 years, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftspeople has delivered cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of AI driven digital transformation. Since 2001, we have grown into a full service digital consulting company with 5500+ professionals working on a worldwide ambition. Driven by the desire to make a difference, we keep innovating. Fuelling the growth of our company with our knowledge worker culture. When teaming up with Xebia, expect in-depth expertise based on an authentic, value-led, and high quality way of working that inspires all we do.




About the Role

We are looking for a seasoned Analyst and Data Visualisation Expert to support the data science and analytics team focused on Direct To Consumer data products. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools. You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations with especial focus on clickstream data. You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.




Responsibilities

Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.




Your background

3+ years of professional experience analysing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarise, and analyse data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. e-commerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.

Title: Junior Data Science
Description:
Samba TV tracks streaming and broadcast video across the world with our proprietary data and technology. We are on a mission to fundamentally transform the viewing experience for everyone. Our data enables media companies to connect with audiences for new shows and movies, and enables advertisers to engage viewers and measure reach across all their devices. We have an amazing story with a unique perspective on culture formed by a global footprint of data and AI-driven insights.




We’re looking for a Junior Data Scientist to support our data operations by handling large-scale datasets, ensuring data quality, and running algorithms to match external data with our proprietary datasets. This role is ideal for someone detail-oriented, eager to work with real-world data, and looking to grow into a more analytical position over time.




Key Responsibilities:
Collect, process, and clean data received from clients to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Assist in developing new algorithms.
Identify and troubleshoot data inconsistencies or gaps, working with internal teams and clients to resolve issues.
Support data validation and quality assurance processes to improve the reliability of our datasets.
Assist in creating reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate findings.
Collaborate with senior data scientists, engineers, and Product teams to enhance our data pipelines and algorithms.




Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or similar).
2 years of experience in data analysis, data processing, or related fields
Experience with data visualization (e.g., Databricks Tableau, Seaborn) and data cleaning & processing (e.g., Pandas, SQL).
Strong programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and big data tools (e.g., PySpark) is a plus
Excellent problem-solving skills and a willingness to take ownership of data-related tasks.




Why Join Us?
Gain hands-on experience working with real-world, large-scale datasets.
Learn from experienced data scientists and engineers in a collaborative environment.
Exposure to data engineering, matching algorithms, and cloud technologies.







Samba TV is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  We strive to empower connection with one another, reflect the communities we serve, and tackle meaningful projects that make a real impact.

Samba TV may collect personal information directly from you, as a job applicant, Samba TV may also receive personal information from third parties, for example, in connection with a background, employment or reference check, in accordance with the applicable law. For further details, please see Samba's Applicant Privacy Policy. For residents of the EU , Samba Inc. is the data controller.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
SymBio Recruitment GmbH steht für mehr als nur Personalvermittlung.

Wir sind Ihre Wegbegleiter in der Welt der beruflichen Entwicklung.




Unser Ziel ist es, nicht nur Unternehmen und Fachkräfte zusammenzubringen, sondern auch Ihre persönlichen Stärken und beruflichen Ambitionen optimal zu fördern. Wir nehmen uns die Zeit, Ihre individuellen Bedürfnisse zu verstehen und bieten Ihnen eine maßgeschneiderte Betreuung, die über den üblichen Standard hinausgeht.




Standort: Nürnberg

Anstellungsart: Festanstellung – Unbefristet - Vollzeit

Arbeitsmodell: Hybrid




Weiterentwicklung und Optimierung bestehender Dashboards und Reporting-Tools
Enge Abstimmung mit den Fachabteilungen zur Erstellung präziser und aussagekräftiger Analysen
Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Strategien zur Datenintegration und Analyse, insbesondere zur Unterstützung von Finanzplanung, Budgetierung und Prognosen
Sicherstellung einer hohen Datenqualität und -verfügbarkeit durch regelmäßige Validierung und Anpassung der Datenprozesse
Konsolidierung und Modellierung von Daten aus unterschiedlichen Quellen, um wertvolle Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen




Ihr Profil:

Fundierte Berufserfahrung in den oben genannten Bereichen, idealerweise mit Branchenkenntnissen in der Logistik oder Spedition
Sicherer Umgang mit BI- und Analyse-Tools, vorzugsweise Power BI
Kenntnisse in SQL-basierten Datenmodellen und Datenaufbereitungen sind von Vorteil
Analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen sowie Freude an der Verbindung von Fachwissen und IT-Lösungen
Kommunikationsstärke und Teamgeist zur erfolgreichen Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift C1 Level




Das bietet unser Mandant

Modernes und innovatives Arbeitsumfeld mit Zukunftsperspektive.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten & Home-Office-Möglichkeiten.
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten zur fachlichen und persönlichen Entwicklung.
Attraktive Vergütung und Karrierechancen in einem dynamischen Unternehmen.
Spannende Projekte mit den neuesten Technologien im Bereich RPA & Digitalisierung.

SymBio Recruitment GmbH steht für mehr als nur Personalvermittlung.

Wir sind Ihre Wegbegleiter in der Welt der beruflichen Entwicklung.


Unser Ziel ist es, nicht nur Unternehmen und Fachkräfte zusammenzubringen, sondern auch Ihre persönlichen Stärken und beruflichen Ambitionen optimal zu fördern. Wir nehmen uns die Zeit, Ihre individuellen Bedürfnisse zu verstehen und bieten Ihnen eine maßgeschneiderte Betreuung, die über den üblichen Standard hinausgeht.


Standort: Nürnberg

Anstellungsart: Festanstellung – Unbefristet - Vollzeit

Arbeitsmodell: Hybrid


  • Weiterentwicklung und Optimierung bestehender Dashboards und Reporting-Tools
  • Enge Abstimmung mit den Fachabteilungen zur Erstellung präziser und aussagekräftiger Analysen
  • Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Strategien zur Datenintegration und Analyse, insbesondere zur Unterstützung von Finanzplanung, Budgetierung und Prognosen
  • Sicherstellung einer hohen Datenqualität und -verfügbarkeit durch regelmäßige Validierung und Anpassung der Datenprozesse
  • Konsolidierung und Modellierung von Daten aus unterschiedlichen Quellen, um wertvolle Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen


Ihr Profil:

  • Fundierte Berufserfahrung in den oben genannten Bereichen, idealerweise mit Branchenkenntnissen in der Logistik oder Spedition
  • Sicherer Umgang mit BI- und Analyse-Tools, vorzugsweise Power BI
  • Kenntnisse in SQL-basierten Datenmodellen und Datenaufbereitungen sind von Vorteil
  • Analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen sowie Freude an der Verbindung von Fachwissen und IT-Lösungen
  • Kommunikationsstärke und Teamgeist zur erfolgreichen Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern
  • Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift C1 Level


Das bietet unser Mandant

  • Modernes und innovatives Arbeitsumfeld mit Zukunftsperspektive.
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten & Home-Office-Möglichkeiten.
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten zur fachlichen und persönlichen Entwicklung.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
🚀At Capgemini Invent, we drive change through inventive transformation consulting, blending strategic, creative, and scientific capabilities to deliver cutting-edge solutions. Join us to tailor transformations to our clients' challenges, validated by science and data, powered by creativity and design, and underpinned by purposeful technology.




Your Role

As a Junior Data Analyst professional, you will guide organizations in managing and leveraging their data assets to drive strategic business outcomes. Your focus will be on data quality, security, governance, and metadata management among others fields of practices.




🌐Key responsibilities:

Advising clients on data governance frameworks, data ethics policies, metadata management strategies, and master data management (MDM) solutions.
Integrating cutting-edge technologies into data management processes, leveraging machine learning and advanced analytics.
Shaping and executing engagements in Data Management, including Data Governance, Data Ethics, Data modeling, Data Architecture, Data Quality, and standards implementation.
Conducting assessments of clients' data maturity using frameworks like DCAM and DAMA.
Cultivating trusted client relationships to address key challenges in data management, analytics, and AI delivery.
Providing strategic counsel on maximizing the value of data-driven insights for business decision-making.
Supporting large-scale data transformations from conceptualization to implementation.
Collaborating with stakeholders to facilitate innovation initiatives.
Establishing robust data capabilities within client organizations, including process optimization and skills development.
Contributing to the development of our practice by identifying new market opportunities and creating thought leadership content.




💡Your Profile:

Innovation: Ability to drive innovation in data management using cutting-edge technologies as Informatica or Collibra.
Value-Creation: Creating tangible value through effective data management and utilization of data assets.
Leadership: Potential as a leader in data management with relevant experience and success.
Strategic Thinking: Providing strategic guidance on data management and roadmap creation.
Stakeholder Management: Strong engagement skills with diverse stakeholders, discovering business needs.
Communication Skills: Effective communication to represent the company in data strategy discussions.
Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying abreast of advancements in data strategy and management.
Delivery: Track record of delivering within agile working environments.




🌟What You'll Love About Working Here

Join our rapidly growing Data & AI Strategy team at Capgemini Invent, where we design and build strategies to transform how organizations leverage data. Our commitment to innovation and AI-driven solutions creates unparalleled value for clients.




We offer flexibility, a positive work-life balance, through hybrid working (80%) and wellbeing options for our employees.




📍Location: Barcelona




Are you ready to take your career to the next level and drive the future of innovation with data?

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Power Platform
Description:
🚀¿Te interesa el mundo del dato, la automatización y las herramientas low-code? ¡Tenemos una gran oportunidad para ti!.




Desde Adecco, nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un perfil Junior Data Analyst con foco en Power Platform para incorporar en un entorno internacional, innovador y con proyectos punteros de visualización y automatización.




🎁 ¿Qué se ofrece?




💼 Contratación directa e indefinida por cliente final.

🏢Modelo híbrido.

📍Ubicación en Málaga.

🌍 Entorno internacional, dinámico y en crecimiento.




💡 ¿Qué harás en este rol?




🔹 Participarás en la automatización de procesos y recogida de requisitos de negocio.

🔹 Desarrollarás dashboards, KPIs y modelos de datos (estrella, copo de nieve).

🔹 Crearás flujos en Power Automate y aplicaciones con Power Apps.

🔹 Modelarás y transformarás datos para facilitar su explotación en Power BI.

🔹 Colaborarás en la definición de roles de acceso y seguridad en visualizaciones.




🎯 Requisitos clave:




✅ Grado o titulación técnica relacionada con Tecnología o Informática.

✅ Conocimiento en Power BI, Power Apps y Power Automate.

✅ Experiencia (académica o práctica) con modelos de datos relacionales.

✅ Metodologías Agile (Jira, Confluence, DevOps).

✅ Español fluido (C1) e inglés intermedio (B2).




🌟 Será un plus si cuentas con:




🔹 Conocimientos en Location Intelligence, Data Governance y visualización avanzada (D3.js, JS).

🔹 Experiencia en pipelines CI/CD (Jenkins) y gestión de calidad del dato.




Si cumples con los requisitos y quieres un nuevo reto, ¡inscríbete ahora! 📩

Title: Data Analyst & Reporting Specialist
Description:
Join Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, where innovation meets opportunity! With over 2 million customers across Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, we're leading the way in digital banking. From loans and mortgages to a cutting-edge, fully automated investment platform, our products are transforming the industry.

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.




If you're passionate about digital innovation, eager to make an impact, and ready to be part of a dynamic and forward-thinking company, then we want to hear from you! Join us and be part of our journey to redefine banking for the digital age!




Mission & Role:

In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and extracting insights from large datasets from various sources in our AWS Datalake, to solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data engineers to implement scalable solutions and ensure that the data you work with is clean and reliable. You will be expected to create actionable results through statistical analysis, data visualization, and software development, enabling decision-making across different teams. You will also play a key role in supporting the team’s efforts to use data more effectively and to automate key business processes.




You will work in a transparent environment where knowledge-sharing and open communication are encouraged. As a team player, you’ll engage with others to reach common goals, making sure to balance both the big picture and fine details.




You will apply your knowledge of statistical analysis and experience with tools like Python or Spark to implement solutions and provide clear insights. Additionally, you will help design and produce efficient data pipelines, contributing to the success of the team and its projects.




To be successful in the role you must bring:

At least +3 years of experience in Statistical Analysis: Strong knowledge of basic statistical concepts and the ability to implement them in programming languages such as Python or Spark. You know when to use different statistical indicators and have experience summarizing insights from data.
Experience with Large Datasets: Familiarity with working on large datasets and implementing scalable solutions. You understand data cleaning, and you know how to collaborate effectively with data engineers.
Problem-Solving with Data: Ability to break down complex problems into manageable analytical components and reuse existing solutions from previous projects.
Software Development Knowledge: Understanding of software development practices, including using Git, writing and testing your code, and leveraging it to produce meaningful results. If you're an open-source enthusiast, we'd love to see your GitHub contributions!
Proficiency in Data Visualization: Experience with tools like ggplot, matplotlib, Tableau, or similar. Bonus points for experience with Microstrategy or QuickSight.
SQL Expertise: You are an SQL ninja, and writing both exploratory and efficient queries is second nature to you.
STEM Background: A degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) is highly desired due to the strong software development component of the role.
Emotional resilience: You can give and take criticism well. You don’t get defensive when your ideas are challenged, and you’re polite enough to challenge others’ ideas when necessary.
Confidence without arrogance: You are confident but not arrogant. You ask for help when needed and openly admit when you don’t know something. You value and celebrate the contributions of others.
Exceptional communication skills: You explain your ideas clearly and succinctly, ask for input, and listen carefully. You build on the ideas of others, and your presentations are impactful without being overwhelming.
Transparency: You value transparency, always willing to share your knowledge and ideas with the team.
Team collaboration: You are a strong team player, supporting and collaborating with others to achieve common goals.




What do we offer?

Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.




Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Show more

  • Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.

  • Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
  • Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.


Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in Málaga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our Málaga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

• Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

• Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

• Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

• Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

• Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

• Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

• Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

• Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

• Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

• Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

• Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

• Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

• Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

• High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

• Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

• Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

• Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

• Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what’s in it for you?

🆙 Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

🏠 Hybrid Work

💰 Competitive compensation structure

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

🛟 Life Insurance

📈 Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

🛬 Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Data analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data analyst

Seniority: Junior (1-3 years)

Type of position: Hybrid model in Oporto. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!

The amazing you, will have:


3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of SQL for querying, data extraction, and manipulation.
Familiarity with ETL processes (experience with Stambia is a plus).
Ability to work with large datasets and optimize data workflows.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Fluent in French and English (both written and spoken).
Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Proficiency in Power BI or other data visualization tools.
Knowledge of data governance and data management best practices.
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Staff Data Scientist, Research, Search Platforms
Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Mountain View, CA, USA; Cambridge, MA, USA.Minimum qualifications:


Master's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
8 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or 6 years of work experience with a PhD degree.


Preferred qualifications:


10 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or 8 years of work experience with a PhD degree.


About The Job

The Search Platform Data Science team works on understanding and measuring Search systems, including but not limited to Experiment, Reliability, Velocity, Latency, Capacity, Content, Logs Quality and Search Infrastructure.

In Google Search, we're reimagining what it means to search for information – any way and anywhere. To do that, we need to solve complex engineering challenges and expand our infrastructure, while maintaining a universally accessible and useful experience that people around the world rely on. In joining the Search team, you'll have an opportunity to make an impact on billions of people globally.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $197,000-$291,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with stakeholders in cross-projects and team settings to identify and clarify business or product questions to answer. Provide feedback to translate and refine business questions into tractable analysis, evaluation metrics, or mathematical models.
Use custom data infrastructure or existing data models as appropriate, using specialized knowledge. Design and evaluate models to mathematically express and solve defined problems with limited precedent.
Research and develop analysis, forecasting, and optimization methods to improve the quality of Google's user facing products. Example application areas include ads quality, search quality, end-user behavioral modeling, and live experiments.
Own the process of gathering, extracting, and compiling data across sources via relevant tools (e.g., SQL, R, Python). Independently format, re-structure, and/or validate data to ensure quality, and review the dataset to ensure it is ready for analysis.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Sustainability Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a specialist real estate consulting firm, is taking an innovative and disruptive approach to structuring property development deals. They are seeking a Sustainability Data Analyst to support data administrative tasks for a large, complex project with a US-based client.




Responsibilities:

Identify and autonomously reach out to global stakeholders to gather essential sustainability data.
Perform thematic analysis of findings, drawing actionable insights before aggregating data.
Assist in the creation and management of an initiative tracking tool for business use.
Handle data-heavy administrative tasks to ensure smooth project operations.




Requirements:

1-2 years of experience in data analysis.
Bachelor's degree in quantitative field
Proven experience with data-heavy administrative tasks.
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights.
Proactive, go-getter, with interest in sustainability




Details:

Start date: ASAP
Location: US-based (remote possible, close to EDT or PDT time zones)
Salary: $60,000 - $80,000 pro-rated Fixed Term Contract
Duration: 6 months

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Supply Chain Data Analyst II

We are seeking an experienced Supply Chain Data Analyst to develop and optimize data-driven insights that enhance operational efficiency. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, technical proficiency, and experience in business intelligence tools to support data modeling and visualization for supply chain metrics.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and optimize supply chain dashboards to track key metrics such as on-time delivery, delivery health, and in-stock performance.
Create end-to-end dashboards utilizing Tableau and AWS Quicksight.
Utilize advanced SQL skills to manipulate, analyze, and extract insights from large datasets.
Work closely with supply chain and manufacturing stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into actionable data insights.
Apply project and program management expertise to streamline data analysis and reporting processes.
Support cost, lead time, and demand data modeling to enhance supply chain efficiency.
Leverage business intelligence tools to drive strategic decision-making and operational improvements.


Top 3 Must-Have Skills


Data Visualization & Dashboarding – Expertise in Tableau, AWS Quicksight, and other visualization tools.
SQL Proficiency – Advanced SQL skills to query and manipulate large datasets effectively.
Business Intelligence & Analytics – Experience in supply chain metrics, cost modeling, and demand forecasting.


Skills & Experience Required


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or Computer Science.
Minimum 2 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or supply chain analytics.
Strong knowledge of supply chain and manufacturing processes.
Proficiency in Excel, including pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, and macros.
Strong stakeholder communication skills for presenting insights and driving data-informed decisions.
Experience with project and program management to improve reporting processes and operational efficiency.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience working with large-scale datasets in a supply chain or manufacturing environment.
Ability to model supply chain costs, lead times, and demand trends.
Familiarity with additional programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.


This role offers an exciting opportunity to leverage data-driven insights to improve supply chain efficiency, working closely with key business stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have a passion for analytics, strong technical skills, and the ability to drive strategic decision-making through data visualization and business intelligence tools.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At H2Ok Innovations, we're leading the charge in cleantech innovation, reshaping process industrials and manufacturing to drive operational efficiency and sustainability for our world’s most foundational industries. Powered by our H2Ok AI Co-pilot models and state-of-the-art sensors, our solutions optimize facility performance across various processes, including process manufacturing, production, water management, energy reduction, and waste minimization. Based at Greentown Labs, North America's premier cleantech innovation community, we're a woman-founded startup backed by renowned investors like Construct Capital, 2048 Ventures, and Flybridge Capital. Our groundbreaking technologies have earned accolades and adoption from industry giants like Unilever, The Coca-Cola Company, ABinBev, and Mitsubishi Electric. We're committed to unlocking untapped data for our customers, empowering them to gain a competitive edge and create Industry 4.0.

Transforming our most foundational sectors of society is hard. Very hard. But we’re building an empire. And empire building is not easy. It’s deeply fulfilling, and you will learn and grow tremendously while driving sustainable impact globally with some of the largest players that make everything we eat, use, and wear. Our culture is to foster extraordinary growth within our teammates. We believe in autonomy, ownership, empowerment, demanding excellence, being mission-driven. We believe in creativity, authenticity, and extraordinary growth. We’re looking for relentless, ambitious, creative, and exceptional people to join our team and build the factory of the future.

As our company scales, we're in search of a full-time Data Analyst to join our expanding team. As a Data Analyst, you will work directly with customers on high-impact immediate problems – interpreting, explaining, and ultimately bringing life to their data. Based on your analysis, you will use H2Ok’s ML platform to build machine learning models that drive value for our customers, saving them time, water, and energy. Your responsibilities will look similar to those of a hands-on AI startup CTO where you will work cross-functionally in sales, customer success, and product delivery to own the delivery of high-impact projects to global clients. The ideal candidate is an excellent critical thinker, a clear and engaging communicator, and knows how to not only explain data, but how to tell a compelling story. Having a background in chemical engineering, process engineering, mechanical engineering, or computer science is a plus.

What You Will Do


Analyze data from some of the largest factories in the world to identify process inefficiencies, anomalies, and areas of potential optimization
Interpret, explain, and shed light on complex data through engaging presentations and live demonstrations to customers and internal stakeholders.
Use H2Ok’s ML platform to train, evaluate, and deploy machine learning models to unlock additional factory uptime and deliver time, energy, and water savings.
Apply critical thinking and first principles knowledge to solve challenging, real-world problems in factories, breweries, food & beverage facilities, and more.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and customer stakeholders to ensure models are performant, reliable, and aligned with customer needs





About You


Fluent in analyzing, understanding, and communicating about data, especially time-series data or sensor data.
Willing to work directly with customers to explain model results, data analysis, and conclusions from data in a clear, engaging, and succinct way.
Skilled in data storytelling and visualization.
Can create engaging, colorful visualizations for customers that bring data to life and provide insight.
Experienced with presenting data and communicating results to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Experienced with Python, including numerical libraries (such as NumPy and Pandas) and familiar with at least one ML framework (such as Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX).
Familiar training, fine-tuning, and evaluating performance of machine learning models. Familiar with SQL or similar database systems (such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
Experienced with Git or other version control systems
Analytical thinker with the ability to solve complex problems efficiently
Excellent communication skills to articulate technical issues, solutions, and progress effectively
Adaptability to learn new technologies and adapt to evolving project requirements
Strong team player mindset, comfortable sharing knowledge and collaborating within a team environment
Familiarity with industrial processes and manufacturing industries such as chemicals, pharmaceuticals, food and beverage, CPG, brewing, dairy, and industrial controls (PLC/SCADA/DCS) is a strong plus





Benefits


Direct impact on product and culture
Comprehensive benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Disability, Transportation benefit, Health and Wellness benefit, and more
401k plan with employer matching
Equity
Competitive salary and bonus opportunities
Dynamic and inclusive work environment
Opportunities for growth and professional development
Access to Greentown Labs' extensive network of cleantech startups





Learn How We Think


Learn about our startup journey: Our Journey
How we're combating climate change: AI-Powered Climate Tech
A customer story: Ben & Jerry's uses H2Ok's precision automation to cut time & water usage





Why H2Ok Innovations?
Impact: Work on cutting-edge AI and sensor tech that’s already transforming how factories use water, energy, and chemicals. Join a tight-knit, ambitious team where your contributions can reshape the industry.

Growth: Join a fast-growing startup where you’ll have the opportunity to shape our content strategy. We value fostering extraordinary growth in our teammates.

Innovative Culture: Work in a high-performance environment that values empowerment, creativity, ownership, autonomy, innovation, excellence, passion, and continuous growth.

Sustainability Focus: Play a key role in promoting sustainability and Industry 4.0 advancements in manufacturing.

Build the intelligence layer powering the next generation of industrial efficiency – with a team that moves fast and delivers real impact.

At H2Ok Innovations, we’re committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and we encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. If you're ready to play a key role in scaling a game-changing company that’s transforming the industrial sector and advancing sustainability, we want to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Geode Capital Management is seeking a dedicated individual to join the Data Operations Team as an Associate Data Analyst. The Associate Data Analyst will play a primary role in ensuring our key data assets are complete, accurate, and ready for use by the firm on a daily basis. The individual will triage issues as they arise, escalate when appropriate, and execute any required corrective action. Through investigation and coordination with teams across the firm, the Analyst is expected to proactively improve the quality of our data and processes. In this role, the Analyst will become a “go-to” expert on investment data sets while supporting Portfolio Management, Trading, Research and other internal stakeholders.

This is a hybrid work environment opportunity located in Boston, Massachusetts with a weekly in office schedule of Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays and remote work availability on Mondays and Fridays.

Who Are You?


Appreciates the criticality of good, clean, data, that helps drive business impact
Team player - willingness to help with any task needed for team success
Clear communicator who can explain complex data problems in concise language
Determined, curious, and industrious



Responsibilities:


Serve as operational data steward for multiple sets of data assets including Security Reference, Index, and Market data
Validate the day-to-day completeness, accuracy and quality of all data used in the investment process
Identify possible data anomalies and research the root causes
Triage problems and flag critical issues for escalation to appropriate parties both internal and external
Collaborate with colleagues across the business for clear resolutions
Develop metrics, validations, reports/dashboards to evaluate and monitor data quality
Contribute to the continuous improvement of data pipelines
Identify ways to streamline our processes and automate standard maintenance
Take ownership of data quality and integrity in new initiatives and projects across the firm
Perform operational duties to support both Technology and Business teams as required



Skills You Bring:


4+ years of related experience in investment operations
BS/MS (Economics, Finance, Computer Science or related major)
Strong technical background and the ability to work independently
Strong SQL experience (minimum 3 years)
Experience working with various asset classes including equities, fixed-income securities, and derivatives
Security, Index, or any other Master Data Management (MDM) Experience
Flexibility to cover the morning (6:00am – 3:00pm) or afternoon (10:00am-7:00pm) shifts on a rotational basis
Strong working knowledge of Excel, Databases, Snowflake, Python
High attention to detail and supreme quality, while balancing both practicality and value-creation
Experience with Jira or similar Agile management tools



Company Overview:

Founded in 2001, Geode is headquartered in Boston’s financial district, the center of one of the world’s most vibrant finance and technology hubs and employs approximately 180 employees.

Geode is a systematic asset manager providing core beta exposures across a range of equity and niche asset classes, with over $1 trillion in AUM. With a robust infrastructure and experienced investment professionals, Geode offers the scale of a large asset management firm with the benefits of a smaller organization.

Geode is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and support a diversified work environment. Learn more about Geode at www.geodecapital.com.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business. Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forcasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 2 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with SQL
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$94,900 - $117,000

What You'll Do:

  • Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
  • Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
  • Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
  • Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
  • Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Business Analyst – Supply Chain & Data Intelligence

Onsite | Boston, MA 02210

9-Month W2 Contract | $35–$45/Hour (Based on Experience)




Russell Tobin is proud to partner with one of the world’s most innovative technology and logistics pioneers in their search for a Business Analyst to support their Global Robotics Operations team. This is an exciting opportunity to work on high-impact supply chain and operational analytics in a dynamic, data-driven environment!




What You’ll Do

As a Business Analyst, you'll play a key role in building and optimizing dashboards that provide insight into critical supply chain metrics such as on-time delivery, delivery health, and inventory status. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams in robotics and operations to bring clarity and foresight to fast-moving logistics.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain end-to-end dashboards using Tableau and AWS Quicksight
Leverage advanced SQL to query large datasets and extract actionable insights
Partner with supply chain and manufacturing stakeholders to understand and deliver data needs
Support program and project management initiatives across robotics operations
Translate complex data models into meaningful visuals and business narratives




What We’re Looking For




Top 3 Must-Have Skills:

Data Visualization & BI Tools – Strong experience in Tableau, SQL, and Quicksight
SQL Expertise – Ability to manipulate and query complex datasets
Supply Chain Fluency – Experience working with operations, logistics, or manufacturing teams




Preferred Qualifications:

2+ years of experience in data analysis or business intelligence
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science)
Proficiency in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, Macros)
Familiarity with Python or R is a plus
Strong project/program management skills
Excellent stakeholder communication and business storytelling




Why This Role?

This is a backfill opportunity on a high-visibility team that's powering the future of robotics, automation, and fulfillment operations. If you're someone who thrives in fast-paced, metric-driven environments and aligns with principles like "Dive Deep" and "Deliver Results," this could be your next big move.




Ready to make an impact? Apply now and let’s connect you with the team shaping the future of modern commerce.




Benefits Info

Pride Global offers eligible employee’s comprehensive healthcare coverage (medical, dental, and vision plans), supplemental coverage (accident insurance, critical illness insurance and hospital indemnity), 401(k)-retirement savings, life & disability insurance, an employee assistance program, legal support, auto, home insurance, pet insurance and employee discounts with preferred vendors.

Title: Coordinator, Data & Analytics
Description:
WHAT MAKES US A GREAT PLACE TO WORK

We are proud to be consistently recognized as one of the world's best places to work, a champion of diversity and a model of social responsibility. We are currently ranked the #1 consulting firm on Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work list, and we have maintained a spot in the top four on Glassdoor's list for the last 13 years. We believe that diversity, inclusion and collaboration is key to building extraordinary teams. We hire people with exceptional talents, abilities and potential, then create an environment where you can become the best version of yourself and thrive both professionally and personally.  We are publicly recognized by external parties such as Fortune, Vault, Mogul, Working Mother, Glassdoor and the Human Rights Campaign for being a great place to work for diversity and inclusion, women, LGBTQ and parents.

WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH

Analytics, Data & Research

WHERE YOU'LL FIT WITHIN THE TEAM

As a key member of the Americas Talent Acquisition Operations Data & Analytics team, the Coordinator will support the collection, organization, and advanced reporting of recruiting data from various platforms, including our ATS and data visualization tools. This role will play a critical part in leveraging data to provide reporting and insights that drive strategic decision-making in our recruiting processes. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical capabilities with the ability to grow into a subject matter expert within recruiting data and analytics, developing compelling insights that answer the most critical questions that influence significant change within our operating model.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

Data Integrity and Management (40%)

Execute zero-defect collection, cleaning, and preparation of recruiting data to ensure accuracy, consistency, and readiness for analysis.
Maintain data integrity standards by identifying and correcting errors, inconsistencies, and missing values before analysis.
Format data by structuring it into usable formats.
Merge/map data from various sources to create comprehensive datasets for more insightful analysis.
Identify opportunities to automate repetitive data processes and tasks.

Data Visualization and Reporting (40%)

Build interactive dashboards using tools like Tableau to allow stakeholders to explore key metrics and insights.
Present findings in a clear, concise manner using visuals to effectively communicate complex data insights to non-technical audiences.
Create both automated and ad hoc reports and slides that summarize key data insights for decision makers.
Regularly present data insights in meetings, tailoring reports to the needs and technical understanding of different recruiting teams and centers of excellence.

Data Analysis and Interpretation (20%)

Perform statistical tests (i.e., hypothesis testing) to uncover patterns and trends in recruiting data.
Conduct data exploration to discover relationships and anomalies to support better analysis.
Analyze historical data to detect trends, behaviors, and inefficiencies.
Link data findings to business outcomes and provide actionable insights that help solve key business challenges.

ABOUT YOU

Bachelor's degree with high academic achievement
1-2 years of experience in a data analyst role or heavy exposure to similar work.
Strong analytical ability to synthesize data to identify trends, patterns, and generate insights.
Exposure to statistical analysis methods (i.e., regression, hypothesis testing) and tools such as R, Python, and/or SPSS.
Knowledge of data management processes and database structures.
Expert in creating visual representations of data using tools like Excel, PPT, and other more comprehensive tools like Tableau, PowerBI to communicate insights effectively. 
Strong attention to detail, organizational and project management skills, ensuring data accuracy and precision throughout the analysis process.
Strong capability to approach complex problems with logical reasoning.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with a passion for understanding and addressing customer needs. 
Ability and desire to learn and implement new tools and techniques as the data landscape evolves.

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

Title: Data Visualization Analyst (Tableau)
Description:
Data Visualization Analyst

Boston, MA (Hybrid)




Reporting to the Director of Business Intelligence of Enterprise Data and Solutions of Information Technology, the Data Visualization Analyst is a key contributor to the Business Intelligence team responsible for the development of BI solutions through dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to answer key data and business questions for decision support. The role analyzes complex datasets to solve business issues, ensures data quality, data policies and standards are enforced across the College’s ecosystem. The Analyst will participate in multi-year BI program initiatives in designing, developing, testing and training business users on BI products. This position requires hands-on dashboard development experience, with solid data analysis and data modeling skills. Experience developing solutions using industry-leading BI tools, such as Tableau, and working with scaling the campus operational reporting platform, Argos, are key success factors. The position plays a key role in the creation and delivery of the business intelligence strategy that shapes the future of the college’s data analytics. Excellent data query and data analytical ability with strong academic and business knowledge are essential.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES

Contribute to the strategic planning process for business intelligence initiatives, recommend innovative technologies, methods, and industry-leading tools and best practices, design and maintenance of a system to warehouse data and information, including structured and unstructured data sets.
Scale Argos and Tableau platforms through building advanced dashboards and incorporate new and diversified data sources. Actively organize and participate in data literacy, report and dashboard training to key business users. Through storytelling to evolve data analytics for department engagement.
Manages all technical aspects of our business intelligence environment, including data transformation and governance, performance monitoring and identification and support of analytics tools.
Use complex data analysis and query, data science and data modeling techniques to develop report and data analytics solutions for decision support. This includes developing data models, engineering solutions in the form of business dashboards, reports and data visualizations integrating with other 3rd party applications.
Partner with academic units and business departments such as Institutional Research, Enrollment Management, Registrar, Finance, HR, Financial Aid and Institutional Advancement to define and execute potential BI initiatives. Analyze data needs, gather report or dashboard requirements, perform data mapping including multiple internal data sources and/or the use of public data, to create BI solutions to solve business issues. This often involves conducting complex root cause analysis to troubleshoot data discrepancies, work with end users to correct business processes, and systematically cleanse inaccurate data sets.
Identify performance metrics and KPIs with relevant business area leaders. Apply innovative visualization and data science techniques to develop interactive dashboards, and to analyze and interpret trends or patterns using a large data population.
Effectively work and collaborate with PMO on BI projects, ensure deliverables are completed on time, and objectives are met.
Manage tables and data views within Oracle database, SQL Server, PostgreSQL and synchronize with data models with corresponding data mapping and appropriate ETL tools. Keep current on the latest technologies, develop proof-of-concept prototypes to advance the BI program.
Commit to professional development by fostering a climate of team learning, cross-training and knowledge base building.
Handle complex data issues with minimal supervision, while escalating critical issues to management using sound judgment. Enforce data quality, knowledge retention, and process consistency through the curation and expansion of the institutional data dictionary/catalog.
Communicate effectively with internal team and external business users through written, verbal and visual storytelling. Develop detailed technical specifications, data mapping and data flow documentations for major data analytics projects.
Perform other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business or a similar degree, combined work experience and education as equivalent. Higher Education experience preferred
10 years of experience as data visualization analyst, business intelligence analyst or advanced report writer.
5+ years of Tableau Dashboard development experience.
Experience working with data stewards, data governance, and data standards.
Experience working with Ellucian Banner, Slate, Canvas or Workday preferred
Certification in Tableau or other applicable business intelligence tools preferred
Experience in data warehouse or data modeling preferred
Familiarity with HelioCampus, Redshift, Python or other scripting or data integration technologies preferred

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

Strong SQL query and Oracle relational databases skills.
Strong Excel skill and efficient use of visual tools.
Ability to optimize performance of dashboards and data sources.
Ability to extract diverse datasets, perform data mapping, and ETL data transformation.
Knowledge of SDLC and project management best practices.

PHYSICAL ABILITIES

Requires ability to lift and move objects that are light
Requires ability to move materials occasionally

WORK ENVIRONMENT

Usual Office Conditions
